summary: A memo dated November 18, 2019, detailing the International Peace Institute's (IPI) connections to Jeffrey Epstein's charitable foundations, including donations and an allegation that young, unqualified Eastern European women were placed as short-term trainees at IPI and had their photos sent to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose foundations (Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation and Gratitude America LTD) made donations to the International Peace Institute (IPI). The memo also references an allegation that photos of young female trainees at IPI were sent to him.

persons.name: Terje Rod-Larsen
persons.role: President of the International Peace Institute (IPI)
persons.context: Norwegian national who has been President of IPI since 2005, as stated in the memo describing the organization.

persons.name: Kevin Rudd
persons.role: Chair of the IPI Board of Directors
persons.context: Former Prime Minister of Australia, identified as the chair of IPI's Board of Directors.

persons.name: Antonio Guterres
persons.role: Honorary Chair of the IPI Board of Directors
persons.context: Secretary-General of the United Nations, identified as the Honorary Chair of IPI's Board of Directors.

persons.name: Richard Hooper
persons.context: A fellowship fund at IPI was established in his honor by the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation.

connections.description: Epstein's foundations (Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation and Gratitude America LTD) donated money to IPI, including for a fellowship and the launch of a regional office.
Allegation that photos of young, unqualified Eastern European female trainees placed at IPI were sent to Epstein.
Rod-Larsen is the President of IPI.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation founded
events.description: One of Epstein's charitable foundations was established in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: IPI Richard Hooper Fellowship launched
events.description: The International Peace Institute launched a fellowship fund honoring Richard Hooper, established with support from the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation.

events.title: Gratitude America LTD founded
events.description: Another of Epstein's charitable foundations was established in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.

events.title: IPI Bahrain office launch supported
events.description: The Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation supported the launch of IPI's regional office in Bahrain.

events.title: Alleged trainee placements at IPI
events.description: An unnamed source alleges that during this period, young, unqualified Eastern European women were placed as short-term trainees at IPI, and their photos from UN visits were sent to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Daily Beast report on Gratitude America donation
events.description: The Daily Beast reported, based on tax returns, that Gratitude America LTD donated $375,000 to IPI.

events.title: Memo written
events.description: This memo summarizing IPI's connections to Jeffrey Epstein was written in Oslo.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's foundations, the Jeffrey Epstein VI Foundation and Gratitude America LTD, made financial donations to the International Peace Institute (IPI), a think tank with ties to the UN.
A $375,000 donation from Epstein's Gratitude America LTD to IPI was reported by The Daily Beast in August 2019 based on tax returns.

An allegation from a source claims that between November 2014 and April 2016, young, beautiful, and unqualified Eastern European women were placed as short-term trainees at IPI, and photos of them at the UN were sent to Jeffrey Epstein.
The memo notes that the source's identity is known but not disclosed, and that neither the source nor IPI had been contacted to verify the allegations as of November 2019.
IPI's leadership included high-profile figures such as President Terje Rod-Larsen, Board Chair Kevin Rudd (former Australian PM), and Honorary Chair Antonio Guterres (UN Secretary-General).
